Description: Funerary papyrus of Pakharenkhons Pawerem; sheet 6; Hieratic text recto and verso.
Cultures/periods: Graeco-Roman (new suggested date: 307/6 BCE due to the colophon on sheet 11)
Curator's comments: The papyrus yields 8 compositions in 50 columns. This sheet contains the Great Ceremonies of Geb. Bibliography: Vernus, RdE 41, p. 153-208. To be published by F. Herbin, Late Religious Texts. 2 The Beatifications are published in J. Assmann et al. Altaegyptische Totenliturgien III Osirisliturgien in Papyri derSpaetzeit (Heidelberg 2008).
Tarasenko, Mykola. 2016. Studies on the vignettes from chapter 17 of the Book of the Dead. I, The image of mś.w Bdšt in ancient Egyptian mythology (Archaeopress Egyptology 16), Oxford, p. 29.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (189)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57226) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57226)
Gill 2019a / The hieratic ritual books of Pawerem (P. BM EA 10252 and P. BM EA 10081) from the late 4th century BC
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss, fractured Black ink Red ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Window verso Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair
